title: Afroasiatic languages
summary: Afroasiatic (Afro-Asiatic), also known as Afrasian or Hamito-Semitic,[2] Semito-Hamitic,[3] or Erythraean,[4] is a large language family of about 300 languages that are spoken predominantly in Western Asia, North Africa, the Horn of Africa and parts of the Sahel.[5] With the exception of Semitic, all branches of the Afro–∞siatic family are spoken exclusively on the African continent.
